010package imagingbook.common.noise.hashing;
011
012import java.util.concurrent.ThreadLocalRandom;
013
014/**
015 * <p>
016 * Interface to all hash functions defined in this package. 
017 * Typical usage example:
018 * </p>
019 * 
020 * <pre>
021 * HashFun hf = new Hash32Ward(seed);
022 * double g = hf.hash(u); // g is in [-1,+1]
023 * double g = hf.hash(u, v);
024 * double[] g = hf.hash(u, v, w);
025 * </pre>
026 * <p>
027 * Omit seed in the constructor call or use seed = 0 to get a random seed hash function of the
028 * specified type.
029 * </p>
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2022/11/24
033 */
034public interface HashFunction {
035        
036        static int getRandomSeed(int seed) {
037                int s = (seed == 0) ? ThreadLocalRandom.current().nextInt() : seed;
038                return 0x000fffff & s;
039        }
040        
041        /**
042         * 1D hash function: maps a single {@code int} key to a {@code double} hash
043         * value in [0,1].
044         * 
045         * @param u the key
046         * @return the hash value
047         */
048        public double hash(int u);                                      // 1D hash function
049        
050        /**
051         * 2D hash function: maps a pair of {@code int} keys to a pair of {@code double}
052         * hash values in [0,1].
053         * 
054         * @param u the 1st key
055         * @param v the 2nd key
056         * @return the hash values
057         */
058        public double[] hash(int u, int v);             // 2D hash function
059        
060        /**
061         * 3D hash function: maps a triplet of {@code int} keys to a triplet of
062         * {@code double} hash values in [0,1].
063         * 
064         * @param u the 1st key
065         * @param v the 2nd key
066         * @param w the 3rd key
067         * @return the hash values
068         */
069        public double[] hash(int u, int v, int w);
070        
071        /**
072         * N-dimensional hash function: maps a N-vector of {@code int} keys to N-vector
073         * of {@code double} hash values in [0,1].
074         * 
075         * @param p a N-vector of keys
076         * @return a N-vector of hash values
077         */
078        public double[] hash(int[] p);
079        
080}
081
082
